intro: Prosopanche bertoniensis f. normalis, commonly known as the normal form of Bertoni's ghostplant, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its fibrous root system and hairy, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
